means: Western Humor and Irony Membership Yearbook <西部幽默和讽刺成员年鉴>

sentence.Network_en: His speech was full of whimsy.
They are like oracular messages, but witty - jaunty at times - and sometimes trembling on the edge of whimsy.
sentence.Network_cn: 它们都像神谕, 但很机智,有时极其轻快,有时又濒于怪诞.

sentence.Network_en: I must confess, I'm guilty of the same foolish whimsy.
sentence.Network_cn: 我承认, 我和你一样干过这样的蠢事.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 新概念第四册单词总汇[旺旺英语论坛] ... hypocrisy 伪善 whimsy 怪念头 flimsy 站不住脚的.
以w开头的英语英文单词 ... whimsical 古怪的，异想天开的 whimsy 古怪，异想天开 whine 哀号，号哭.
心理学专业英语词汇（三） ... whimsicality 异想天开 whimsy 奇想 whine 发牢骚.
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(W) ... whimsicality 心情浮动 whimsy 心情浮动 whin 棘豆.

remarks : beautiful young people are the whimsy of nature , but beautiful old people are true works of art .领事寄语：美丽的年轻人是大自然的奇想，而美丽的老年人却是艺术的杰作。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the sense 'caprice'): probably based on whim-wham

entry.tran: 奇思异想;不同寻常的行为
entry.def: Whimsy is behaviour which is unusual, playful, and unpredictable, rather than having any serious reason or purpose behind it.

means.word_mean: 1. an odd or fanciful or capricious idea;

sentences.sentence: "the theatrical notion of disguise is associated with disaster in his stories"
"he had a whimsy about flying to the moon"
"whimsy can be humorous to someone with time to enjoy it"

means.word_mean: 2. the trait of acting unpredictably and more from whim or caprice than from reason or judgment;

sentences.sentence: "I despair at the flightiness and whimsicality of my memory"
